de.thinktel.foragingBee.masonGlue
Class ForagingBeeGUI

java.lang.Object
  sim.display.GUIState
      de.thinktel.foragingBee.masonGlue.ForagingBeeGUI
Direct Known Subclasses:
ForagingBeeGUI2D, ForagingBeeGUI3D
public abstract class ForagingBeeGUI
extends sim.display.GUIState

This class provides an interface for a 2D display of the simulation results. This is a glue class that is gluing MASON with the basic simulation. An instance of class SimState holds the simulation with all simulation parameters. This class usually takes an instance of ForagingHoneyBeeSimulation or more likely one of the subclasses as an argument.

Changes:

  • 20090827: Added the windows for displaying the amount of foraging bees and the amount of honey in the hives (one hive at the moment).
  • 20090828: Changed this class to a abstract to allow 2D and 3D subclass visualization.

Copyright 2009 Joerg Hoehne

Author:
hoehne (Jörg Höhne)

Constructor Detail

ForagingBeeGUI

public ForagingBeeGUI(ForagingHoneyBeeSimulation sim)
A constructor that creates a instance with the current system time as an argument. The holds information about the simulation but does not visualize. Visualization is implemented by the subclasses.

This class creates the visuals so it calls ForagingHoneyBeeSimulation.prepareSimulation() to create all objects that will be displayed in the model inspector user interface.
